attack-object.name: Brute Force
attack-object.comments: Note that MFA that is triggered in response to privileged operations (such as assigning a user a privileged role) are considered functionality of the Azure AD Privileged Identity Management control.  Consult the mapping for this control for the ATT&CK (sub-)techniques it maps to.  This mapping specifically deals with MFA when it is enabled as a security default.
attack-object.score-comment: MFA provides significant protection against password compromises, requiring the adversary to complete an additional authentication method before their access is permitted.

attack-object.name: Valid Accounts
attack-object.comments: Note that MFA that is triggered in response to privileged operations (such as assigning a user a privileged role) are considered functionality of the Azure AD Privileged Identity Management control.  Consult the mapping for this control for the ATT&CK (sub-)techniques it maps to.  This mapping specifically deals with MFA when it is enabled as a security default.
attack-object.score-comment: This control only protects cloud accounts and therefore its overall protection coverage is Minimal.
